SEARCH
Package implementazioni_postgres_dao

Class LuggageDAOImpl

java.lang.Object
implementazioni_postgres_dao.LuggageDAOImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
LuggageDAO
public class LuggageDAOImpl extends Object implements LuggageDAO
PostgreSQL implementation of the LuggageDAO interface for managing luggage operations in the airport management system.

This class provides concrete implementations for all luggage-related database operations defined in the LuggageDAO interface. It handles comprehensive luggage management functions including lost luggage retrieval, booking-specific luggage queries, and luggage status management operations using PostgreSQL database connectivity.

The implementation provides comprehensive luggage management capabilities including:

  • Complete lost luggage retrieval with associated flight, passenger, and booking data
  • Booking-specific luggage information retrieval for customer service operations
  • Luggage status management including lost luggage reporting and tracking
  • Integration with flight, booking, ticket, passenger, and customer data systems
  • Comprehensive luggage tracking from booking through final delivery or loss

All database operations use prepared statements to prevent SQL injection attacks and ensure data security. The class implements proper connection management using the singleton ConnessioneDatabase pattern and handles resource cleanup through try-with-resources statements.

The class handles complex multi-table operations that join multiple related entities:

  • FLIGHT table for flight information and scheduling details
  • BOOKING table for reservation data and customer associations
  • TICKET table for individual passenger tickets and seat assignments
  • PASSENGER table for passenger personal information
  • LUGGAGE table for luggage specifications, status, and tracking data
  • CUSTOMER table for customer account information and contact details

Luggage data handling includes special processing for various data types:

  • Seat assignments: converted from 1-based database storage to 0-based application indexing
  • Timestamp processing: proper conversion from database timestamps to Java Date/Time objects
  • Nullable luggage IDs: handled consistently with null values for unassigned luggage
  • Luggage status tracking: supports all luggage lifecycle states (BOOKED, LOADED, WITHDRAWABLE, LOST)

The implementation supports various luggage operational scenarios including customer service inquiries, lost luggage recovery operations, booking management, and administrative reporting. All methods maintain data integrity through proper transaction handling and provide comprehensive error logging for operational monitoring.

All methods follow the contract defined by the LuggageDAO interface and maintain data consistency through proper error handling, connection management, and resource cleanup. The class uses appropriate SQL data types including PostgreSQL enums for luggage status management.

Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • getAllLostLuggages

      public void getAllLostLuggages(List<String> flightIds, List<String> companyNames, List<Date> flightDates, List<Time> departureTimes, List<Time> arrivalTimes, List<String> flightStatus, List<Integer> maxSeats, List<Integer> freeSeats, List<String> cities, List<Boolean> flightTypes, List<Integer> buyerIds, List<String> usernames, List<String> mails, List<String> hashedPasswords, List<Date> bookingDates, List<String> bookingStatus, List<Integer> bookingIds, List<String> ticketNumbers, List<Integer> seats, List<Boolean> checkedIns, List<String> firstNames, List<String> lastNames, List<String> passengerSSNs, List<Date> birthDates, List<Integer> luggageIds, List<String> luggageTypes, List<String> luggageStatus, List<String> luggageIdsAfterCheckin) throws SQLException
      Retrieves comprehensive information about all lost luggage items in the system.

      This method performs a complex query to fetch complete information about all luggage items that have been reported as lost (luggage_status = 'LOST'). It provides a comprehensive view of lost luggage including associated flight details, passenger information, booking data, and luggage specifications for recovery and customer service operations.

      The method joins multiple database tables (FLIGHT, BOOKING, TICKET, PASSENGER, LUGGAGE, CUSTOMER) to provide complete lost luggage information. All lists are populated with corresponding data at the same index positions, allowing for easy data correlation and processing.

      The retrieved data includes:

      • Complete flight information including schedules and airline details
      • Customer account information for notification and contact purposes
      • Booking details including status and creation timestamps
      • Ticket information with seat assignments and check-in status
      • Passenger personal information for identification and contact
      • Luggage specifications including type, status, and tracking identifiers

      Results are ordered by flight departure time in descending order to prioritize recent lost luggage items. Only luggage associated with non-deleted customer accounts is included in the results to maintain data integrity.

      This method is particularly useful for lost luggage recovery operations, customer service inquiries, and administrative reporting on baggage handling performance and recovery statistics.

      This implementation executes a complex SQL query that joins multiple tables (FLIGHT, BOOKING, TICKET, PASSENGER, LUGGAGE, CUSTOMER) to retrieve comprehensive information about all lost luggage items in the system. The query filters for luggage with status 'LOST' and excludes deleted customer accounts to maintain data integrity.

      The method processes various data types appropriately:

      • Timestamps: converted from database timestamps to separate Date and Time objects
      • Seat assignments: converted from 1-based database storage to 0-based application indexing
      • Luggage IDs: handled with null values when id_luggage ≤ 0 (not assigned)
      • Flight types: boolean values indicating departing (true) or arriving (false) flights

      The query uses NATURAL JOIN for FLIGHT and BOOKING tables to efficiently link flight and booking data, while using explicit JOINs for other relationships to maintain proper data associations. Results are ordered by flight departure time in descending order to prioritize recent lost luggage items.

      This method is essential for lost luggage recovery operations, providing complete information needed for customer contact, luggage identification, and recovery coordination. The comprehensive data set supports both customer service operations and administrative reporting on baggage handling performance.

      Specified by:
      getAllLostLuggages in interface LuggageDAO
      Parameters:
      flightIds - list to be populated with flight identifiers
      companyNames - list to be populated with airline company names
      flightDates - list to be populated with flight dates derived from departure timestamps
      departureTimes - list to be populated with flight departure times
      arrivalTimes - list to be populated with flight arrival times
      flightStatus - list to be populated with current flight status values
      maxSeats - list to be populated with flight maximum seating capacity
      freeSeats - list to be populated with available seats count
      cities - list to be populated with destination or origin city names
      flightTypes - list to be populated with flight type indicators (true for departing, false for arriving)
      buyerIds - list to be populated with customer identifiers who made the bookings
      usernames - list to be populated with customer usernames
      mails - list to be populated with customer email addresses
      hashedPasswords - list to be populated with customer password hashes
      bookingDates - list to be populated with booking creation timestamps
      bookingStatus - list to be populated with booking status values
      bookingIds - list to be populated with unique booking identifiers
      ticketNumbers - list to be populated with ticket numbers
      seats - list to be populated with seat assignments (null if not assigned, 0-based indexing)
      checkedIns - list to be populated with check-in status indicators
      firstNames - list to be populated with passenger first names
      lastNames - list to be populated with passenger last names
      passengerSSNs - list to be populated with passenger SSN identifiers
      birthDates - list to be populated with passenger birth dates
      luggageIds - list to be populated with luggage identifiers (null if no luggage)
      luggageTypes - list to be populated with luggage type descriptions (CARRY_ON or CHECKED)
      luggageStatus - list to be populated with luggage status values (should be 'LOST')
      luggageIdsAfterCheckin - list to be populated with post-checkin luggage identifiers
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the data retrieval operation

    • getAllLuggagesOfBooking

      public void getAllLuggagesOfBooking(Integer bookingId, List<String> ticketNumbers, List<Integer> luggageIds, List<String> luggageTypes, List<String> luggageStatus, List<String> luggageIdsAfterCheckin) throws SQLException
      Retrieves all luggage items associated with a specific booking.

      This method fetches comprehensive luggage information for all luggage items associated with a particular booking. It provides detailed luggage data including identification, type, status, and associated ticket information for customer service operations and booking management purposes.

      The method joins multiple database tables (BOOKING, TICKET, PASSENGER, LUGGAGE, CUSTOMER) to provide complete luggage information for the specified booking. All lists are populated with corresponding data at the same index positions, enabling easy correlation between luggage items and their associated tickets.

      The retrieved data includes:

      • Ticket numbers associated with each luggage item
      • Luggage database identifiers for system tracking
      • Post-checkin luggage identifiers for physical tracking
      • Luggage type classification (CARRY_ON or CHECKED)
      • Current luggage status throughout handling lifecycle

      Results are ordered by ticket number to provide consistent ordering and enable easy correlation with passenger and ticket information. The method handles cases where luggage may not have been assigned a physical ID yet by including null values in the luggageIds list.

      This method is particularly useful for customer service operations, check-in procedures, luggage management tasks, and booking modification processes where complete luggage information is required.

      This implementation executes a SQL query that joins multiple tables (BOOKING, TICKET, PASSENGER, LUGGAGE, CUSTOMER) to retrieve comprehensive luggage information for all luggage items associated with a specific booking. The query uses LEFT JOIN with the LUGGAGE table to ensure tickets without associated luggage are still included.

      The method handles nullable luggage data appropriately:

      • Luggage IDs: null values when id_luggage ≤ 0 (no luggage assigned to ticket)
      • Post-checkin IDs: string values for physical luggage tracking after check-in
      • Luggage types and status: retrieved directly from database enum values

      Results are ordered by ticket number to provide consistent ordering and enable easy correlation with passenger and ticket information. This ordering facilitates organized display of luggage information grouped by tickets within the booking.

      The LEFT JOIN ensures that all tickets in the booking are included in the results, even if they don't have associated luggage items. This provides complete booking information for customer service and operational purposes.

      This method is particularly useful for customer service operations, check-in procedures, luggage management tasks, and booking modification processes where complete luggage information for a specific booking is required.

      Specified by:
      getAllLuggagesOfBooking in interface LuggageDAO
      Parameters:
      bookingId - the unique identifier of the booking to retrieve luggage for
      ticketNumbers - list to be populated with ticket numbers associated with each luggage item
      luggageIds - list to be populated with luggage database identifiers (null if not assigned)
      luggageTypes - list to be populated with luggage type descriptions (CARRY_ON or CHECKED)
      luggageStatus - list to be populated with luggage status values (BOOKED, LOADED, WITHDRAWABLE, LOST)
      luggageIdsAfterCheckin - list to be populated with post-checkin luggage identifiers for physical tracking
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the data retrieval operation

    • lostLuggage

      public void lostLuggage(String ticket, String luggageStatus)
      Updates the status of a luggage item to indicate it has been lost.

      This method performs a luggage status update operation to mark luggage as lost using the post-checkin luggage identifier. It uses PostgreSQL's enum casting to ensure proper luggage status validation and data integrity.

      The method updates luggage status based on the post-checkin identifier (id_luggage_after_check_in) rather than the original luggage ID, as this identifier is used for physical luggage tracking after passengers have checked in and luggage has entered the baggage handling system.

      Common luggage status transitions handled by this method include:

      • LOADED LOST (luggage loaded but went missing during handling)
      • WITHDRAWABLE LOST (luggage ready for pickup but reported missing)
      • Any status LOST (administrative override for lost luggage reporting)

      The method includes comprehensive error handling with logging to track luggage status update operations and any failures that may occur during the update process. This is crucial for luggage tracking and audit purposes.

      This operation is typically triggered by customer reports of missing luggage, baggage handling system notifications, or administrative actions when luggage cannot be located or delivered to passengers.

      Parameters:
      ticket - the post-checkin luggage identifier used for physical tracking
      luggageStatus - the new luggage status to set (typically "LOST" but can be other valid status values)
